AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the PEACE team in any publication based upon use of this data.
AccessInformation.Caveats: See CSDS User's Guide, DS-MPA-TN-0015, for post procesing caveats This is PEACE PP/SP data version 3, produced at MSSL Positions in GSE coordinates are available in the CSDS:NDR:CL_SP_AUX product.

Dimension.Description: Date and time in ISO 8601 recommended primary standard notation.

In the status word each of the 4 bytes has a different meaning, the first of which is the CSDS-defined quality flag applied to the PEACE data. Status[0] - Data quality defined by CSDS Status[1] - Missing data indicator and on-board processing mode Status[2] - On-board instrument status Status[3] - Data processing warning flags. See CSDS User Guide (ftp://ftp.estec.esa.nl/pub/csds/task_for/users_guide/csds_guide-1_1.pdf).

PhysicalParameter.Description: The electron density averaged over one minute in units of number per cm^-3.

Dimension.Description: A single value giving the electron density.

PhysicalParameter.Name: N_e_den

PhysicalParameter.Description: The electron velocity averaged over one minute in units of km.s^-1.

Dimension.Description: The three components of the electron velocity vector messured in GSE coordinates.

PhysicalParameter.Name: V_e_xyz_gse

PhysicalParameter.Description: The electron temperature parallel to the magnetic field averaged over one minute in units of 10^6K.

Dimension.Description: A single value giving the electron temperature parallel to the magnetic field.

PhysicalParameter.Name: T_e_par

PhysicalParameter.Description: The electron temperature perpendicular to the magnetic field averaged over one minute in units of 10^6K.

Dimension.Description: A single value giving the electron temperature perpendicular to the magnetic field.

PhysicalParameter.Name: T_e_perp

PhysicalParameter.Description: The electron heat flux parallel to the magnetic field averaged over one minute in units of µJ m^−2 s^−1.

Dimension.Description: A single value giving the electron heat flux parallel to the magnetic field.

PhysicalParameter.Name: Q_e_par

ResourceHeader.Description: The PEACE (Plasma Electron and Current Experiment) electron analyser measures the electron velocity distribution function at the satellite in three dimensions with good time, energy, and angular resolution. The CSDS PEACE parameters are all derived from a subset of the moment sums calculated onboard and the procedure is described in more detail in the CSDS User's Guide (ftp://ftp.estec.esa.nl/pub/csds/task_for/users_guide/csds_guide-1_1.pdf). For the CSDS Summary Parameter product, PEACE provides a status word, the electron density, the three averaged components of the electron velocity vector in the GSE coordinate system, the electron temperature parallel and perpendiculer to the magnetic field and the elctron heat flux parallel to the magnetic field. These summary parameters are one minute averaged measurements from the PEACE experiment on the Cluster C3 spacecraft. The magnetic field direction is determined from FGM data. The positions in the GSE coordinate system are found in the Auxiliary Summary product (CL_SP_AUX).
